docs.snippet: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.--The Board met at noon yesterday. Present Drs. THOMPSON, ROCKWELL and MILLER. The Mayor was too ill to attend, owing to an attack of neuralgia. The schooner A. P. Howe, from Havana, was allowed a permit to come up eight days...
docs.lead_paragraph: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.--The Board met at noon yesterday. Present Drs. THOMPSON, ROCKWELL and MILLER. The Mayor was too ill to attend, owing to an attack of neuralgia. The schooner A. P. Howe, from Havana, was allowed a permit to come up eight days after discharging.

docs.snippet: Our worst fears with regard to the fate of the passengers and crew of the steamship Austria are more than realized. Out of five hundred and sixty persons on board, only sixty-seven are believed to have been saved! The ship caught tire in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Our worst fears with regard to the fate of the passengers and crew of the steamship Austria are more than realized. Out of five hundred and sixty persons on board, only sixty-seven are believed to have been saved! The ship caught tire in the steerage, while being fumigated with burning tar on the 13th instant, in latitude 45[degrees] 01, longitude 41[degrees] 30',

docs.snippet: An inquisition was commenced Saturday morning, at Bellevue Hospital, by Coroner CONNERY, in the case of Mrs. SOPHIA STEPHENS, alleged to have been poisoned by her husband, JAMES STEPHENS, about a year ago. But few persons were present. After the...

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; INQUISITION BEFORE CORONER CONNERY--TESTMONY OF SOPHIA AND FANNY RELL. The Alleged Wife-Poisoning Case. NEW-YORK HOSPITAL.- Homicide in First-avenue.

docs.lead_paragraph: An inquisition was commenced Saturday morning, at Bellevue Hospital, by Coroner CONNERY, in the case of Mrs. SOPHIA STEPHENS, alleged to have been poisoned by her husband, JAMES STEPHENS, about a year ago. But few persons were present. After the impanneling of a jury, the two sisters, SOPHIA and FANNY BELL, neices of the deceased, upon whose affidavit, before Justice WELSH, STEPHENS was arrested were examined.

headline.main: THE QUARANTINE WAR.; Arguments of the Commissioners for Removal in Favor of their New Project.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following is an abstract of the arguements offered by the Quarantine Commissioners in support of the Report of Quarantine removal, made by them in Albany, on the 24 th inst : GENTLEMEN : The report just read is made in pursuance of section 3 of the law of 1857 for Quarantine removal. docs.snippet: QUARANTINE AT BOSTON.-It is getting too late in the season for Boston to run an opposition to New-York on the score of Quarantine. Judging from the frequent mention of yellow fever vessels at anchor near Deer Island during the last two months, our...
docs.lead_paragraph: QUARANTINE AT BOSTON.-It is getting too late in the season for Boston to run an opposition to New-York on the score of Quarantine. Judging from the frequent mention of yellow fever vessels at anchor near Deer Island during the last two months, our Boston neighbors have been fully as careful of their health as we leave.

docs.snippet: GEORGE HALL, of Brooklyn, EGBERT BENSON, New-York, and ORADIAH BROWN, of Staten Island, Commissioners for the removal of quarantine, convened here today for the purpose of presenting a plan for the removal of Quarantine to Governor KING, the...

headline.main: PLAN FOR THE REMOVAL OF QUARANTINE.; Report of the Commissioners Appointed by the Last Legislature.

docs.lead_paragraph: GEORGE HALL, of Brooklyn, EGBERT BENSON, New-York, and ORADIAH BROWN, of Staten Island, Commissioners for the removal of quarantine, convened here today for the purpose of presenting a plan for the removal of Quarantine to Governor KING, the Lieutenant-Governor and the Comptroller, who have supervision over the selection of a site.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Second Anniversary of the New-York Caledonian Club. Board of Aldermen., First Anniversay of the Business Men's Prayer-Meeting. CRICIKET-KINGS COUNTY CLUB vs, NEW-YORK CLUB. THE FEMALE HORSE-RACE. Coroner's Inquests. Police Intelligence. BEATEN BY ROWDIES. ACCIDENTS -JACOB HAYS and THEO, CHILDS. COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.

docs.lead_paragraph: The members of the New-York Caledonian Club, composed of natives of Scotland, resident in this City, could not have selected a more delightful day for their annual out-door recreations than they had yesterday. In the morning, when the Club, which had assembled at 7 A.M. at the Mercer House, arrived within the inclosure on your right-hand side as you enter Jones'
